basics.name: Owen Valentine
basics.label: System/Network/Cloud Engineer
basics.summary: Owen is a seasoned Software Development-adjacent System/Network/Cloud Engineer, most recently at Amazon Web Services. Skilled at Consultation, Technical Support, Technical Documentation, Linux System Engineering, Virtualization and Technical Training

work.summary: AWS is (currently) the world's leading public cloud provider, and a pioneer in the cloud space
highlights: Pioneered the AWS Premium Support Andon Program (PSAP) in Cape Town
Trained >80 engineers globally on Docker, containerization and ECS/Fargate
Maintained a perfect customer satisfaction record
Became a go-to engineer (in a team of >60) for basically any topic in short time
Member of ECS (Elastic Container Service) and CloudEndure support operations

work.summary: Umanix is a small but above-weight-punching Managed Service Provider specializing in Linux, virtualization and cool internet tech
highlights: Managed, maintained and improved full tech stack (Hypervisor cluster, LXC, Nginx, Java, MySQL, LXC) for a large-footprint local BI SaaS provider
Set up and maintained the company's helpdesk system, running Zammad, a Rails app with Postgresql and Elasticsearch
Oversaw the work and training of three technicians, serving as an escalation point

work.summary: Huge Networks is a national Internet Service Provider, providing ADSL, Fibre and Wireless access at various levels, with an enterprise/telecoms focus
highlights: Deployed, maintained and improved a number of POP3/IMAP/SMTP servers, as well as LAMP hosting infrastructure
Managed and maintained RADIUS and proxy RADIUS servers for DSL realms and other PPPoE uses
Handled technical calls and emails from customers, covering all services provided by Huge Networks
Installed wireless/fibre equipment and handled technical support at customer sites

work.summary: Founded and ran a small web hosting business for >3 years. A small number of very happy customers
Hudson Park Primary School is a prominent Eastern Cape institution, educating >1000 students annually
